docs.text: midway through " anaconda " , documentary filmmaker terri flores ( jennifer lopez ) turns to a co-worker and says " i thought this movie would be my first big break .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , it's turned into a disaster . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: truer words have never been spoken .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " anaconda " is a monster movie with a lousy monster .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a suspense film that is utterly predictable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a mess the film does manage to drum up some scares , but only in the most elementary way , like a jack-in-the-box .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as you turn the crank , you're totally aware that the damn clown is going to pop up , but somehow it's still mildly startling when it happens .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the main difference between the giant snake in " anaconda " and the clown in a jack-in-the-box is that the clown is more realistic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " anaconda " boasts some of the worst special effects to appear onscreen in years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: animatronic shots of the snake look as phony as any of those cringe- inducing robots you've endured at disney world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it's the computer animated scenes that truly expand the meaning of the word lame .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in one shot , a character tries to flee from the monster by diving from a tree near a waterfall , but the giant snake springs out and loops around its hapless victim in mid air .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the scene , if done well , would have been a jaw- dropper .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: here , the horribly bad digital effects look less convincing than a saturday morning cartoon .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what's really amazing is that the filmmaker's were so proud of this dreadful shot that they actually included it in the promotional trailers for the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but enough about the phony snakes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: now it's time to talk about the lousy story .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: heroic and very pale anthropologist eric stoltz leads a documentary film crew down a brazilian river in search of the shirishama indians , a legendary tribe that supposedly lives in the boondocks of the rain forest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: stoltz tells his crew " pray that you didn't forget your bug spray . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently the female crew members bathed in the stuff , because they spend most of the film wearing skimpy tops and short shorts with no ill effect .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way , the group rescues a whacked-out lapsed priest ( jon voight ) who claims to know how to find the shirishama .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: within minutes , they throw away all their plans and follow voight down a tributary into the land of creepiness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: from that point on , the film is a hodgepodge of scenes and shots ripped off from " jaws " and " dead calm . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one of the oddest structural points of the film is the handling of eric stoltz .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: early in the story , his character gets knocked into a coma by a river insect and spends virtually the rest of the movie unconscious .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so why did they hire an actor of the caliber of stoltz for what amounts to a cameo appearance ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also , why did stoltz , who generally selects his roles with great care , agree to appear in this crap ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ah , the mysteries of hollywood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the remaining crew members are basically just snake food waiting to happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: jonathan hyde is mildly diverting as a pompous englishman hired to narrate the documentary , but lopez and ice cube manage to rise above their cardboard characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lopez , who starred in " selena , " is an enormously appealing performer , possessing a vibrancy that makes even the most trite lines seem credible .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ice cube has a special charisma ; an ability to look like a macho adult and a frightened boy simultaneously .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's also a special twinkle in his eyes , as if he's gently mocking his own tough-guy posturing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the movie really centers around the outrageously hammy performance of jon voight .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: obsessed with capturing one of the giant anacondas , voight plays the villain in thick accent , with a series of leers and hisses , spouting the kind of dialogue usually heard only in episodes of " jonny quest . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at one point , he looms over the crew and says " the anaconda is the perfect killing machine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it strikes , wraps around you , holds you tighter than your true love .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and you get the privilege of hearing your bones break before the power of its embrace causes your veins to explode .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " that moment is so high-camp that it almost made the film tolerable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: almost .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fans of the horror genre may be tempted to check out " anaconda . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: don't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are a lots of horror films scheduled for release this summer , including another " alien " sequel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: wait for them , rent " jaws " in the meantime , and don't throw away your money and time on drivel like this .
docs.label: negative
